technology.short_description: Dwarf treasuries are often as deep as their vaultsâ€¦ which can be very deep!
The august Toolmakers are a young but powerful Guild, as all Dawi that practise a craft need tools.
In the lower deeps of any Hold are the sealed vaults. They are cool and dark, perfect for storing foodstuffs and other vital supplies.
Dwarfs are not ones for innovation, but refining a process to perfection is a totally different matter!

effects.description: Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Stone Quarries: +5%

technology.short_description: Steam-powered automated drills are a recent, if noisy, invention by the Engineers' Guild.

effects.description: Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Stone Quarries: +8%

technology.short_description: The 'Grims' - small Dwarf tokens attached to their products - are a sign of quality even the manlings understand.

effects.description: Income from Gem Cutters and Obsidian Quarries: +5%

technology.short_description: It is in the Guild halls where the ruling councils meet to discuss policy, tariffs, and to further their goals.

effects.description: Income from Gem Cutters and Obsidian Quarries: +10%

technology.short_description: To grow the Everlasting Realm, the Guilds send subsidies to make settlements old and new sustainable.
When a Dawi is in need of decent hammer or az, the tool market is the place to find it.
Dwarf grinding stones are always perfectly round and decorated with geometric scrawls and runes, usually of Valaya's making.
Dwarfen picks of Gromril are rare, but only needed when mining for star-iron ore, as like finds like.

effects.description: Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Stone Quarries: +4%

technology.short_description: Dwarf prospectors are experienced miners. It is said they can even uncover new seams by smell rather than sight.

effects.description: Income from Salt Mines, Pottery Production and Dyemakers: +4%

technology.short_description: Using tar and hide, the Dwarfs can effectively waterproof certain supplies that are otherwise prone to spoilage.

effects.description: Income from Salt Mines, Pottery Production and Dyemakers: +5%

technology.short_description: Thanks to the Guilds, Dwarfs excel at getting resources out of the ground - no matter how deep!

effects.description: Income from Salt Mines, Pottery Production and Dyemakers: +8%

technology.short_description: A powerful, authoritative voice in any Hold, the Guilds dominate Dwarfen civil life, controlling trade, finances and labour.
Thanes speak with the word of their King, and so the Guilds' rarely question such direct commands.
Dwarfholds tend to trade with each other via the Underway, which keeps prying eyes out of Dawi business.
The Royal Clan is entitled to its tithe. The Reckoners guarantee that the Guilds pay up.
Dwarfs are industrious. When the Guilds call for construction, their members gather and work their beards off!
Along with the Engineers, the Construction Guilds are some of the most powerful, for every Dwarf needs a home.

effects.description: Construction time: -2 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Master Engineers

technology.short_description: The Runepriests bestow Grungni's Blessing on Guild works, ensuring profitable ventures for all.
Nepotism is not a dirty word in Dwarf society. The Guilds encourage it, for family honour is prized.
As Dwarf Guilds wield such power, it makes sense that the Clans keep an eye on them, ensuring competence and honesty.

effects.description: Masters of Steel and Stone commandment: additional -4% to recruitment cost

technology.short_description: Karaz Ankor states that, while all Dwarfholds swear fealty to the High King, they are ruled independently.

effects.description: Empower the Guilds commandment: additional 15 growth

technology.short_description: The tombs of the Ancestors are shrines, for Dwarfs revere age, experience and unbroken blood lines.

effects.description: Venerate the Ancestors commandment: additional 1 corruption reduction

technology.short_description: The grander the Throne Chamber, the more envious and intimidated the King's audience or 'guests' will be.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
High King's Tribute commandment: additional 4% income

technology.short_description: Grumpy, straight-talking Dwarfs do not make the best diplomats, yet some are better at it than others!

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: Dwarfen Emissaries use their forbearance of other races to play the game of diplomacy as well as any Elf, lacing palms with oathgold as needed.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: Every Dwarf must make unbreakable oaths to his King. Only the most scraggiest of beard-wearers would think to break them.
Thorgrim brooks no fools, Dawi or otherwise. He is stern - even for a High King - and his authority is absolute.
Some tombs lay closed, forever sealed with stones covered in ancient runes that glow when evil lurks nearby.
Dwarf Runepriests are rare, but when they visit the Holds they inscribe the Protection of Valaya upon home and hearth.
The putting together of great Dwarfen heads always results in the optimal solution, even when facing the foulest, most abominable problem.

effects.description: Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Stone Quarries: +4%

Attribute: Causes Fear when fighting against Skaven
	(all characters)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

technology.short_description: Every Dwarf practices a trade, but as war is common each Clan readily forms into one or more regiments.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Dwarf Warriors and Miners units
Melee defence: +3 for Dwarf Warriors and Miners units

technology.short_description: All members of the Clan will answer its call, swearing oaths against those who have wronged them.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Dwarf Warriors units

technology.short_description: Skilled in fighting at the vanguard of the Dwarfsâ€™ main force, Rangers fulfil a dangerous role fraught with risk and unimaginable peril.
If you want a job doing properly, albeit with some moaning, then get a Longbeard.
Dwarfs like to drink, sing and tell tall-tales. However, some stories concerning veterans may actually be true.
In the deeps, the Ironbreakers are always on call, ready to defend the Hold from threats below.

effects.description: Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Irondrake units

technology.short_description: Even amongst the Ironbreakers there are Ironbeards - veterans that have fought and survived countless underground battles.
As both honour and sworn duty, the Hammerers are the royal guard, accompanying Lord or King into battle.
A Slayer's wrath is not something enemies wish to see - they do not fear death, they crave it!
Once word is given that it's war, the message quickly passes down the ranks from Kings to Lords to Thanes.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -4% for Dwarf Warriors units

technology.short_description: The resolve of the Dwarfs is legendary. Once they are set upon a task, nothing can stop them.
Dwarfs excel at shieldwalls. Over the years, the Guilds, at the Clans' request, have experimented with interlocking shield designs.
No Longbeard would ever consider breaking an oath. If he promised to come, there he will be.
A rolling Dwarfen song contains many verses and a constant rhythm, used to keep in step and up to pace.
The so-called "Iron Price" is not the wage, but the cost of having troops away from normal duty.
Ironbreakers and their kin, the Irondrakes, have a sacred duty to protect the deeps of their Karaks.
To read aloud from the Hold's Book of Grudges is to enrage all Dawi and bring them to battle.
Those that have taken the Slayer Oath must seek their doom in combat to appease an earlier shame.
When the Thanes call to gather the throngs, it is the Clans that answer, for they have bonds stronger than Gromril.
By standing atop an Oath Stone, followers' resolve is increased, ensuring a champion's foes can find him in the scrum.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Melee defence: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: A Dawi Lord's retainers are his loyal servants and bodyguards, be they shield or throne bearers.

effects.description: Armour: +3 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Weapon strength: +4% for Dwarf Lords and embedded Dwarf Heroes

technology.short_description: Dwarfen weaponsmithing is the finest in the world - a gift from the Guilds to their fellow Clans-kin.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Dwarf units with hand weapons
Weapon strength: +5% for Dwarf units with mining picks

technology.short_description: Dwarfen runes empower weapons already forged by the finest smiths, making a potent axe a truly deadly item.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Dwarf units with two-handed axes
Weapon strength: +5% for Dwarf units with hammers

technology.short_description: Dwarfs are expert armourers, both as creators and wearers. They have the skills to fashion it and the sturdy frames to bear its weight.
With the aid of Runesmiths, new armoured suits have been developed to withstand high temperatures, as well as enemy strikes.

effects.description: Armour: +5 for Irondrakes and Ironbreakers units
Melee defence: +5 for Ironbreakers and Hammerers units

technology.short_description: When the Runepriests enter a Karak, they will stop at the Shrine of Grimnir, granting his favour to any who wish it.
Dwarfs with a penchant for picking the urks off from afar will form Thunderer or Quarreller units.
Dwarfen wagon trains transport case loads of shot, buckets of crossbow bolts, and casks of black powder to the coming fight.
Dwarfs prefer accuracy to firing rates, as they realise that increased firepower does not necessarily cause higher casualties.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for Ranger Units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Quarrellers units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Thunderers units

technology.short_description: Artillery Engineers soon found that the benefit of keeping certain parts modular allowed for improvements in the manufacturing process.
At a Clan's request, Field Engineers are sent by their Guild, attached to artillery to ensure increased rates of fire.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for artillery units

technology.short_description: Dwarfs excel at artillery placement and creating bulwarks and trenches for their defence.
Combining runes of lifting with heavy armour plate increases protection without compromising a 'copter's ability to fly!

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Gyrocopter and Gyrobomber units

technology.short_description: Regulating pressure is an important aspect of many Dwarf devices. New, self-releasing valves heighten such performance.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Gyrocopter and Gyrobomber units

technology.short_description: Puresteel crossbows are precision-crafted instruments, able to accurately deliver death from afar.

effects.description: Base missile damage: +6% for Ranger units

technology.short_description: Deadeyes can pick off a grobi's nose at a hundred paces. For really good ones, it's twice that range.
The Clans constantly order in black powder and make demands for better quality, deadlier batches as well.
The alchemical brew used to fuel the flaming drakeguns can be made more potent, if a tad more unstableâ€¦
Again the Dwarfen forges speak, casting a new type of ammunition - large shells filled with cinderblast.
Automated assembly lines increase production but also safeguard quality, according to the Guilds anyway.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5% for Gyrocopter and Gyrobomber units
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Gyrocopter and Gyrobomber units

technology.short_description: Not just any beardling can operate war machines, so the Engineers' Guild ensures only approved crew operate its instruments.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Gyrocopter and Gyrobomber units

technology.short_description: Innovations in engine mechanics means faster 'copters. Even now, many aircraft are being retro-fitted with improved engines.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Gyrocopter and Gyrobomber units
Ammunition: +25% for Gyrocopter and Gyrobomber units
Attribute: Fire Whilst Moving for Gyrocopter units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can fire while on the move.
